content.description: First pitch. Hand jams and face climbing take you to the first tree ledgePitch 2. Through the hole and around other side to yellow plated chickenheads and cracks to get to base of the smooth facePitch 3. Move belay to right side of ledge with lots of trees.  Pitch 4. Up gnarly chimneys or avoid them and bust out right on low angle terrain and up to another cool ledge Pitch 5.  Fun chimney moves and up onto the face with more cracks. Last 30 feet is an easy chimney with face holds
content.location: Starts on West side and last two pitches are on East side of tower

content.description: Variety of spires and free standing formations along the Mt kimball trail. Located Just below 7,000 feet and only about 30 minutes before the Mt. Kimball summit.  The tallest piece of rock up there is a 3 or 4 pitch tower which is hard to miss.
